verses.kjv: The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
verses.web: A revelation about Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
verses.ct: This is the message of judgment against Nineveh — the vision recorded by Nahum the Elkoshite.

verses.kjv: God is jealous, and the LORD revengeth; the LORD revengeth, and is furious; the LORD will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserveth wrath for his enemies.
verses.web: LORD is a jealous God and avenges. LORD avenges and is full of wrath. LORD takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.
verses.ct: God is jealous, and the LORD takes revenge. The LORD takes revenge and is filled with fury. The LORD brings vengeance against his adversaries and holds on to his wrath against his enemies.

verses.kjv: The LORD is slow to anger, and great in power, and will not at all acquit the wicked: the LORD hath his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.
verses.web: LORD is slow to anger, and great in power, and will by no means leave the guilty unpunished. LORD has his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.
verses.ct: The LORD is slow to anger but immense in power, and he will never let the guilty go unpunished. The LORD marches through the whirlwind and the storm, and the clouds are nothing but dust beneath his feet.

verses.kjv: He rebuketh the sea, and maketh it dry, and drieth up all the rivers: Bashan languisheth, and Carmel, and the flower of Lebanon languisheth.
verses.web: He rebukes the sea, and makes it dry, and dries up all the rivers. Bashan languishes, and Carmel; and the flower of Lebanon languishes.
verses.ct: He commands the sea, and it dries up. He drains every river. Bashan and Carmel wither, and the blossoms of Lebanon fade away.

verses.kjv: The mountains quake at him, and the hills melt, and the earth is burned at his presence, yea, the world, and all that dwell therein.
verses.web: The mountains quake before him, and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, yes, the world, and all who dwell in it.
verses.ct: Mountains tremble before him, and hills melt away. The earth shakes at his presence — the whole world and everyone living in it.

verses.kjv: Who can stand before his indignation? and who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? his fury is poured out like fire, and the rocks are thrown down by him.
verses.web: Who can stand before his indignation? Who can endure the fierceness of his anger? His wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken apart by him.
verses.ct: Who can stand against his fury? Who can endure the heat of his anger? His wrath pours out like fire, and solid rock shatters before him.

verses.kjv: The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
verses.web: LORD is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those who take refuge in him.
verses.ct: The LORD is good — a fortress in times of trouble. He knows every person who trusts in him.

verses.kjv: But with an overrunning flood he will make an utter end of the place thereof, and darkness shall pursue his enemies.
verses.web: But with an overflowing flood, he will make a full end of her place, and will pursue his enemies into darkness.
verses.ct: But with a rushing flood he will completely destroy Nineveh's place, and darkness will chase down his enemies.

verses.kjv: What do ye imagine against the LORD? he will make an utter end: affliction shall not rise up the second time.
verses.web: What do you plot against LORD? He will make a full end. Affliction won’t rise up the second time.
verses.ct: What are you scheming against the LORD? He will bring total destruction — no one will need to deal with this threat a second time.

verses.kjv: For while they be folden together as thorns, and while they are drunken as drunkards, they shall be devoured as stubble fully dry.
verses.web: For entangled like thorns, and drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly like dry stubble.
verses.ct: They may be tangled together like thorns and soaked like drunkards, but they will be consumed like bone-dry straw.

verses.kjv: There is one come out of thee, that imagineth evil against the LORD, a wicked counsellor.
verses.web: There is one gone out of you, who devises evil against LORD, who counsels wickedness.
verses.ct: From you, Nineveh, came one who plotted evil against the LORD — a counselor of wickedness.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Though they be quiet, and likewise many, yet thus shall they be cut down, when he shall pass through. Though I have afflicted thee, I will afflict thee no more.
verses.web: LORD says: “Though they be in full strength, and likewise many, even so they will be cut down, and he shall pass away. Though I have afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Even though they are at full strength and vast in number, they will still be cut down and swept away. Judah, I have put you through suffering, but I will not do so again.

verses.kjv: For now will I break his yoke from off thee, and will burst thy bonds in sunder.
verses.web: Now I will break his yoke from off you, and will burst your bonds apart.”
verses.ct: Right now I will snap his yoke off your neck and tear your chains apart."

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath given a commandment concerning thee, that no more of thy name be sown: out of the house of thy gods will I cut off the graven image and the molten image: I will make thy grave; for thou art vile.
verses.web: LORD has commanded concerning you: “No more descendants will bear your name. Out of the house of your gods, I will cut off the engraved image and the molten image. I will make your grave, for you are vile.”
verses.ct: The LORD has issued this decree against you, Nineveh: "Your name will have no descendants to carry it on. I will destroy every carved idol and metal image in the temples of your gods. I will prepare your grave, because you are worthless."

verses.kjv: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.
verses.web: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace! Keep your feasts, Judah! Perform your vows, for the wicked one will no more pass through you. He is utterly cut off.
verses.ct: Look! There on the mountains — the feet of a messenger bringing good news, announcing peace! Judah, celebrate your feasts! Fulfill your vows! The wicked will never invade your land again. They have been completely destroyed.
